results.description: Uses ts_zscore on rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum (20-day) to capture short-term momentum relative to its recent distribution. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using a high-userCount style factor; SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector fields). Coverage >0.6 so ts_backfill not needed (SUGGESTION3). Chose a well-used field (SUGGESTION4). Confidence set to 0.72 because momentum has persistent cross-sectional signal but mean-reversion risks exist.

Apply ts_zscore to rsk70_mfm2_usfast_1drevrsl over 5 days to detect short-term mean-reversion. Followed SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4 by using a high-userCount 1d reversal factor. No vectors (SUGGESTION2) and coverage is 1.0 so no ts_backfill. Confidence 0.68 reflecting high short-term profitability but transaction costs risk.

results.idea: Idiosyncratic return scaled by specific risk
results.description: Scale daily_specific_return by inverse of specific_risk_variance to favor high idiosyncratic return with low idiosyncratic variance. Used two fields (SUGGESTION1) with high user counts; no vector. Coverage=1 so no backfill. Confidence 0.77 due to direct alpha from specific returns after risk scaling.

Short stocks with high hedge_fund_ownership_percent (crowded) and go long low ownership. Used hedge_fund_ownership_percent (high userCount) per SUGGESTION4. Single field implementation (SUGGESTION1 partially). No vector/backfill. Confidence 0.65 because crowding unwinds can be profitable but timing risk exists.

Capture increases in hedge fund ownership count: ts_delta(hedge_fund_ownership_count, 30) zscored to find growing institutional accumulation. Used two related HF fields to follow SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4. Coverage full so no backfill. Confidence 0.6 due to noisy filings cadence.

Long stocks with high short_interest_factor_score but rising daily_specific_return (squeeze). Used two fields (SUGGESTION1) combining short interest and specific return. No vector/backfill. Confidence 0.66 — logic intuitive but execution/timing matters.

Normalize rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum by rsk70_mfm2_usfast_resvol to prefer momentum with low residual volatility. Applied SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4 by using well-known style factors. Coverage high so no backfill. Confidence 0.74 — balances return vs noise.

Combine rsk70_mfm2_usfast_value (value loading) with rsk70_mfm2_usfast_size to favor small-cap value. Used two high-use style fields per SUGGESTION1/4. No vectors; coverage >0.9 so no backfill. Confidence 0.7 for classic value-size premium.

Modulate momentum by rsk70_mfm2_usfast_sentmt to prefer momentum when sentiment is supportive. Used two widely-used fields per SUGGESTION1/4. Coverage 1 so no backfill. Confidence 0.71 — sentiment often enhances momentum signals.

Neutralize momentum against broad_market_factor_score by subtracting its short-term zscore. Used two fields to control market exposure (SUGGESTION1). Coverage full. Confidence 0.69 because market neutrality reduces systemic risk.

Long stocks with low rsk70_mfm2_usfast_earnqlty zscore expecting re-rating. Used earnings-quality field despite slightly lower coverage (0.9512) but >0.6 so no ts_backfill. Applied SUGGESTION4 moderately. Confidence 0.58 because earnings quality is structural and mean-reversion slower.

Long stocks where rsk70_mfm2_usfast_growth (long-term growth) lags rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum — buy momentum outperformance vs growth. Used two high-use fields (SUGGESTION1/4). No backfill needed. Confidence 0.62 since growth/momentum divergence can signal rotation.

Short stocks with high hedge_fund_ownership_percent and low current_market_cap_usd to exploit crowdedness in small names. Two fields used (SUGGESTION1) and preference for high userCount field. No vector/backfill. Confidence 0.64; crowding risk amplified in small caps.

ts_zscore of daily_specific_return over 20 days to capture persistent stock-specific moves. Single-field simple alpha (SUGGESTION1). Chose daily_specific_return due to high userCount (SUGGESTION4). Confidence 0.73 — specific-return momentum is robust historically.

Use rsk70_mfm2_usfast_profit zscore over 90 days to capture improving profit loading. Used a high-userCount style field per SUGGESTION4. Coverage high; no backfill. Confidence 0.6 as profit signals are medium-term.

Long stocks with rising rsk70_mfm2_usfast_resvol: ts_delta over 30 days zscored. Two operators, one field. SUGGESTION1 satisfied; SUGGESTION4 chosen for robustness. Confidence 0.59 — high residual vol can precede big moves but riskier.

Buy when value loading improves and momentum positive: multiply zscores of rsk70_mfm2_usfast_value and rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum. Two fields, both high-userCount per SUGGESTION4. Confidence 0.7 — combines complementary signals.

Normalize daily_specific_return by size: divide ts_zscore(daily_specific_return,20) by ts_zscore(current_market_cap_usd,252) to remove size bias. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1/4. Confidence 0.68 — reduces size tilt.

Short stocks where short_interest_factor_score has increased recently but momentum negative: subtract momentum from short-interest zscore. Two fields used. Coverage full. Confidence 0.61 — timing sensitive.

Long stocks with falling hedge_fund_ownership_percent and negative recent returns (daily_specific_return) indicating potential rebound. Used two fields (SUGGESTION1) and high HF counts (SUGGESTION4). Confidence 0.63 for contrarian rebalances.

Use reverse(broad_market_factor_score) as hedge overlay: when market factor high, take defensive stance. Single-field, SUGGESTION4 used. Coverage 1 so no backfill. Confidence 0.55 — defensive overlay is low alpha but risk-reducing.

Mean-reversion on daily_specific_return for high short_interest_factor_score names: if short interest high, invert recent negative specific returns. Combined two fields per SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.62 — potential short-covering plays.

Prefer momentum where hedge_fund_ownership_percent increasing: multiply momentum zscore by ts_delta of HF ownership percent. Two fields used (SUGGESTION1) with high counts. Confidence 0.67 — institutional buying can amplify momentum.

Long stocks where rsk70_mfm2_usfast_prospect improved vs rsk70_mfm2_usfast_value to capture re-rating. Two style factors used per SUGGESTION1/4. Confidence 0.6 — relies on analyst/prospect changes translating to price.

Use ts_ir(daily_specific_return, 60) approximated by ts_mean/ts_std_dev via ts_ir operator to find persistent idiosyncratic performers. Single field high userCount (SUGGESTION4). Confidence 0.71 as IR emphasizes signal-to-noise.
Short names with high hedge_fund_ownership_percent and high rsk70_mfm2_usfast_value (overvalued). Two fields, both widely used. Confidence 0.58 due to execution risk.

Favor mean-reversion when residual volatility low: divide ts_zscore(rsk70_mfm2_usfast_1drevrsl, 10) by ts_zscore(rsk70_mfm2_usfast_resvol, 60). Two fields used. Confidence 0.66 — reduces false signals from noisy names.
Momentum zscore minus size zscore to prefer momentum in smaller stocks: subtract(ts_zscore(size), ts_zscore(size benchmark)). Uses two style factors per SUGGESTION1/4. Confidence 0.6.

ts_zscore(ts_delta(hedge_fund_ownership_percent, 90), 180) to find names with increasing HF percent momentum. Single field, high counts. Confidence 0.59 given filing lag but persistent accumulation can matter.

When broad_market_factor_score is high, invert momentum signal: multiply reverse(broad_market_factor_score) with momentum zscore. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.57 for defensive momentum.

Multiply rsk70_mfm2_usfast_prospect_specret_daily with daily_specific_return to capture names where prospect model and daily idiosyncratic returns align. Two fields used. Confidence 0.68; alignment indicates stronger idiosyncratic moves.
Reverse short_interest_factor_score to long names with low short interest (crowded-to-be-long). Single field chosen (SUGGESTION1/4). Confidence 0.54 — weaker alpha but low turnover.

Scale momentum by current_market_cap_usd to avoid tiny illiquid extremes: divide ts_zscore(rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum,60) by ts_zscore(current_market_cap_usd,252). Two fields used per SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.66.

Reverse ts_zscore(rsk70_mfm2_usfast_value, 180) to capture value mean reversion vs fundamentals. Single field selected (SUGGESTION1/4). Coverage high so no backfill. Confidence 0.57 — value mean reversion is long horizon.

Short increases in hedge_fund_ownership_percent when specific returns negative: multiply ts_delta(hedge_fund_ownership_percent, 60) with reverse(ts_zscore(daily_specific_return, 5)). Two fields used. Confidence 0.61.
Divide rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum zscore by rsk70_mfm2_usfast_resvol zscore to favor stable momentum. Two fields, high user counts per SUGGESTION4. Confidence 0.72.

results.idea: Specific return momentum filter by HF count
results.description: Multiply ts_zscore(daily_specific_return,20) by ts_zscore(hedge_fund_ownership_count, 180) to emphasize specific-return momentum where HF base is increasing. Two fields used. Confidence 0.65.
Long small caps with improving value loading: multiply reverse(ts_zscore(rsk70_mfm2_usfast_size, 252)) with ts_zscore(rsk70_mfm2_usfast_value, 180). Two fields. Confidence 0.63.
Short names with high hedge_fund_ownership_percent but negative rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum: multiply HF percent by reverse(momentum). Two fields used. Confidence 0.6.
Long names where rsk70_mfm2_usfast_prospect_specret_daily positive and daily_specific_return positive: multiply two zscores. Two fields used, both high coverage. Confidence 0.69.
Use ts_ir of rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum over 90d to prefer persistent momentum signals. Single field; SUGGESTION4 respected. Confidence 0.7 due to persistence emphasis.

Multiply short_interest_factor_score by ts_zscore(rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum, 10) to find shorts where short interest and momentum align (potential squeeze or collapse). Two fields used. Confidence 0.6.
Divide momentum zscore by (1+hedge_fund_ownership_percent) to downweight crowded names. Two fields used; simple and covers SUGGESTION1/4. Confidence 0.65.
Combine rsk70_mfm2_usfast_earnyild zscore with short-term momentum to capture improving yield with momentum. Two fields: earnings yield and momentum. Confidence 0.62.
Long names where hedge_fund_ownership_percent declined sharply (ts_delta negative) but daily_specific_return negative — expect buyback. Two fields. Confidence 0.6.
Use rsk70_mfm2_usfast_prospect_specret_monthly zscore to find names with improving monthly prospect-specific returns. Single field. Confidence 0.64.

Short names with large specific_risk_variance combined with negative daily_specific_return: multiply two fields to penalize high idiosyncratic risk and negative returns. Two fields used. Confidence 0.56.
Multiply rsk70_mfm2_usfast_mgmtqlty zscore with momentum to favor momentum in strong management names. Two fields used; mgmtqlty coverage 0.8817 (>0.6) so no backfill. Confidence 0.63.
Short stocks with rapid increases in hedge_fund_ownership_percent (ts_delta positive large). Single primary HF field used. Confidence 0.58 due to filing lags.
Favor momentum signals if specific risk variance is low: divide momentum zscore by specific_risk_variance zscore. Two fields used. Confidence 0.7.

When HF percent falls and momentum negative, go long (contrarian): multiply reverse(ts_delta(hedge_fund_ownership_percent, 60)) by reverse(ts_zscore(rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum, 20)). Two fields. Confidence 0.6.

Buy undervalued names (value zscore high) with low hedge fund ownership percent: multiply reverse(hedge_fund_ownership_percent) with ts_zscore(rsk70_mfm2_usfast_value, 180). Two fields. Confidence 0.61.
Divide ts_zscore(ts_sum(daily_specific_return, 5), 20) by ts_std_dev(daily_specific_return, 60) to emphasize persistent specific returns relative to volatility. Single field used. Confidence 0.72.
Apply hump to momentum to reduce turnover: hump(ts_zscore(rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum, 30), hump=0.01). Single field; operator hump used to limit turnover (useful practice). Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: HF ownership percent x short interest divergence
results.description: Find conversion opportunities where hedge fund ownership is low but short interest high: multiply reverse(hedge_fund_ownership_percent) with short_interest_factor_score. Two fields used. Confidence 0.59.
Subtract broad_market_factor_score zscore from momentum to find momentum independent of market trend. Two fields; reduces market beta. Confidence 0.63.
Divide hedge_fund_ownership_percent by current_market_cap_usd to find highly owned small caps (crowded small names). Two fields used. Confidence 0.6.
Multiply momentum zscore with rsk70_mfm2_usfast_prospect_specret_daily zscore to confirm momentum with prospect model. Two fields used, both high coverage. Confidence 0.68.
Short names where daily_specific_return negative and specific_risk_variance high: multiply reverse(daily_specific_return) with specific_risk_variance. Two fields used. Confidence 0.55.
Cross-sectional zscore (quantile-like) of hedge_fund_ownership_percent using ts_zscore then quantile to get relative rank. One field used; SUGGESTION4 satisfied. Confidence 0.58.
Long value when rsk70_mfm2_usfast_sentmt positive: multiply value zscore with sentiment zscore. Two fields used. Confidence 0.62.

Long small caps where HF ownership percent decreased recently: multiply reverse(ts_delta(hedge_fund_ownership_percent, 120)) with reverse(ts_zscore(current_market_cap_usd,252)). Two fields used. Confidence 0.59.
Apply ts_decay_linear to momentum to emphasize recent momentum while smoothing older signals: ts_decay_linear(rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum, 60). Single field. Confidence 0.66.
Subtract long-term mean of daily_specific_return (ts_mean 252) from short-term (ts_mean 20) to capture seasonality: ts_av_diff(daily_specific_return, 252). Single field. Confidence 0.64.
Multiply hedge_fund_ownership_percent by rsk70_mfm2_usfast_prospect to find names where HF ownership and prospect align. Two fields used. Confidence 0.6.
Divide ts_zscore(ts_sum(daily_specific_return,5),10) by ts_zscore(rsk70_mfm2_usfast_resvol,60) to focus on clean idiosyncratic momentum. Two fields. Confidence 0.71.
Short names with rising short_interest_factor_score but high hedge_fund_ownership_percent mitigates: subtract HF percent from short-interest zscore. Two fields used. Confidence 0.58.
Buy where momentum > earnings-quality to capture rotation into lower quality winners: subtract earnqlty zscore from momentum zscore. Two fields used. Confidence 0.56.

Target names where hedge_fund_ownership_percent stable (low ts_std_dev) but daily_specific_return volatile — potential mispricing. Use ts_std_dev on HF percent combined with specific return zscore. Two fields. Confidence 0.52.
Favor momentum in names with few hedge funds (less crowded): multiply momentum zscore with reverse(hedge_fund_ownership_count). Two fields used. Confidence 0.6.
Combine high value zscore with recent positive momentum: multiply ts_zscore(rsk70_mfm2_usfast_value,180) with ts_zscore(rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum,30). Two fields used. Confidence 0.67.
Bucket hedge_fund_ownership_percent into deciles and go long lowest decile (contrarian). Uses bucket and single field per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.57.
Short names where short_interest_factor_score high and specific_risk_variance high: multiply two fields. Confidence 0.56.
Multiply momentum zscore with rsk70_mfm2_usfast_prospect_specret_monthly zscore to confirm durable moves. Two fields used. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: HF ownership percent co-movement with specific returns
results.description: Use ts_corr between hedge_fund_ownership_percent and daily_specific_return to find names where HF flows correlate with idiosyncratic returns. Two fields used. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by specific risk variance
results.description: Divide momentum zscore by sqrt(specific_risk_variance) to prefer momentum with lower idiosyncratic risk. Two fields used. Confidence 0.7.

results.idea: HF ownership percent slowdown long bias
results.description: Long names where hedge_fund_ownership_count growth slows (negative ts_delta) and daily_specific_return positive: multiply reverse(ts_delta(hedge_fund_ownership_count, 180)) with ts_zscore(daily_specific_return, 10). Two fields. Confidence 0.58.
Divide rsk70_mfm2_usfast_resvol by ts_zscore(current_market_cap_usd,252) to find small names with high residual vol (trade carefully). Two fields used. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Momentum x HF percent zscore cross
results.description: Cross-sectional zscore of product of momentum and HF percent to find names where both align. Two fields used. Confidence 0.65.
Reverse ts_zscore(rsk70_mfm2_usfast_prospect, 180) to find names where prospect deteriorated (possible oversell). Single field used. Confidence 0.54.
Winsorize ts_zscore(rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum,60) to reduce outlier-driven turnover. Single field; uses winsorize operator to cap extremes. Confidence 0.62.
Compute ts_rank of hedge_fund_ownership_percent (90d) to find stocks with rising HF share relative to themselves. Single field implementation. Confidence 0.56.
Favor momentum in names with low short_interest_factor_score: multiply momentum zscore with reverse(short_interest_factor_score). Two fields used. Confidence 0.61.
Use last_diff_value on daily_specific_return to capture large recent jumps and expect partial reversion: last_diff_value(daily_specific_return, 10). Single field. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: HF ownership percent and prospect divergence
results.description: Short names where HF ownership rising but prospect loading falling: subtract prospect zscore from HF percent delta. Two fields used. Confidence 0.57.
Multiply earnings yield zscore with short-term momentum to capture value with momentum. Two fields. Confidence 0.63.
Divide momentum by (1 + ts_std_dev(hedge_fund_ownership_percent, 180)) to avoid names with unstable HF ownership. Two fields used. Confidence 0.6.
Use ts_kurtosis(daily_specific_return, 60) to penalize names with heavy tails, then multiply with momentum. Two fields used (kurtosis operator and momentum field). Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: HF ownership percent mean-revert with bucket
results.description: Bucket hedge_fund_ownership_percent into 5 buckets and long lowest bucket. Uses bucket and single field. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Momentum trimmed by winsorized specific return
results.description: Multiply momentum by winsorized daily_specific_return to avoid extreme idiosyncratic spikes. Two fields used. Confidence 0.64.
Long decile with lowest HF percent, short decile with highest HF percent using bucketed HF percent. Single field bucketed. Confidence 0.58.
Multiply rsk70_mfm2_usfast_momentum by rsk70_mfm2_usfast_regmom to favor names with both global and regional momentum. Two fields used. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: HF ownership percent extreme tail fade
results.description: Use tail operator to cap extreme HF percent values, then reverse to go contrarian at extremes. Single field with tail and reverse operations. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by market cap percentile
results.description: Divide momentum zscore by quantile(current_market_cap_usd) to favor momentum among smaller market cap percentiles. Two fields used. Confidence 0.62.
Use ts_arg_max on daily_specific_return over 5 days to detect most recent extreme and short accordingly. Single field used. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: HF ownership percent x sentiment divergence
results.description: Short names where hedge_fund_ownership_percent rising but rsk70_mfm2_usfast_sentmt falling: subtract sentiment from HF percent delta. Two fields. Confidence 0.56.
Divide momentum zscore by (1+short_interest_factor_score) to downweight names with heavy short interest. Two fields used. Confidence 0.6.

Long names where rsk70_mfm2_usfast_prospect_specret_daily outperforms its monthly value: ts_delta between daily and monthly prospect specret. Single field (prospect daily and monthly are same group—uses one of them). Confidence 0.61.
Multiply value zscore by reverse(residual volatility zscore) to favor stable value names. Two fields used. Confidence 0.66.

Long names where hedge_fund_ownership_percent has been flat (low days_from_last_change) but recently increased (small ts_delta positive): use days_from_last_change and ts_delta together. Single field operations on HF percent. Confidence 0.55.
Short names with positive momentum but very high specific_risk_variance (mean-reversion risk): multiply momentum zscore by specific risk then reverse. Two fields used. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: HF ownership percent and market factor hedge
results.description: When HF percent aligns with broad market factor (positive correlation), reduce exposure: subtract broad market zscore from HF percent zscore. Two fields used. Confidence 0.56.
Multiply momentum with rsk70_mfm2_usfast_prospect_specret_daily to amplify momentum where prospect model supports it. Two fields used. Confidence 0.67.
Favor momentum in names with low hedge_fund_ownership_count (less crowded): multiply momentum zscore with reverse(hedge_fund_ownership_count). Two fields used. Confidence 0.59.
Buy value names where hedge_fund_ownership_percent decreased significantly (ts_delta negative) expecting mean-revert. Two fields used. Confidence 0.58.
Use ts_mean of hedge_fund_ownership_percent over 180 days to smooth noise, then multiply with momentum zscore. Two fields used. Confidence 0.6.
Short when short_interest_factor_score shows large recent increase: ts_delta short interest 30-day zscore. Single field. Confidence 0.57.
Use tail to clamp extreme daily_specific_return values and reverse extreme winners/losers: reverse(tail(daily_specific_return, lower=-0.2, upper=0.2, newval=0.0)). Single field. Confidence 0.54.
Multiply monthly prospect specret zscore with short-term momentum to capture durable moves: two fields used. Confidence 0.63.
Scale momentum by factor (1 - hedge_fund_ownership_percent) to reduce weight on crowded names: divide momentum zscore by (1 + hedge_fund_ownership_percent). Two fields used. Confidence 0.61.
Prefer value names with rising hedge_fund_ownership_count (institutional validation): multiply value zscore with ts_delta(hedge_fund_ownership_count,180). Two fields used. Confidence 0.6.
Multiply momentum zscore with reverse(specific_risk_variance) to favor lower idiosyncratic noise. Two fields used. Confidence 0.69.
